item.title: RepAir Carbon is making carbon removal machines inspired by batteries
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: RepAir recently raised a $15 million extension to its Series A.

item.title: Founders, your moment is now: Apply for TechCrunch Startup Battlefield 200
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Founders, the battlefield is open. And the bold are stepping forward. Startup Battlefield 200 at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 is now accepting startups to compete in the ultimate pitch showdown in front of over 10,000 tech leaders from around the globe to witness.. This is no ordinary pitch. This is the fight for visibility, capital, and […]

item.title: Revolut, the $45B neobank, posts $1B profit in 2024
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description: Revolut, the $45 billion neobanking startup founded in the U.K., may have put its IPO plans on ice, but its balance sheet is looking pretty hot. The company reported net profit of $1 billion (£790 million) in 2024, while its customer base grew by 38% to 52.5 million, according to its annual report. Revenues increased […]

item.title: Dropbox adds new features to Dash, its AI-powered search tool
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Companies like Google and Microsoft have equipped their productivity suites with AI features and assistants, while startups such as ClickUp and ReadAI have focused heavily on building AI integrations and search capabilities. In alignment with this growing trend of infusing digital work suites with AI, Dropbox on Thursday upgraded its AI search tool, Dash, first […]

item.title: Uber, Volkswagen pair up to launch robotaxi service in US with self-driving, electric microbuses
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Volkswagen of America and Uber on Thursday unveiled an ambitious plan to launch a commercial robotaxi service — using autonomous electric VW ID. BUZZ vehicles — in multiple U.S. cities over the next decade. The companies expect to launch a commercial service in Los Angeles, the first city on the list, by late 2026. VW […]

item.title: This tool estimates how much electricity your chatbot messages consume
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: Ever wonder how much electricity you’re using when you prompt, or thank, an AI model? Hugging Face engineer Julien Delavande did, so he built a tool to help arrive at the answer. AI models consume energy each time they’re run. They’re run on GPUs and specialized chips that need a lot of power to carry […]

item.title: British startup Isembard lands $9M to reshore manufacturing for critical industries
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Geopolitical pressures are accelerating a demand in many countries and regions to reshore — that is, to redevelop critical industry infrastructure, and to bring back businesses, which had moved or outsourced some or all of their industrial operations to cheaper countries further away. But that is easier said than done. In the key area of […]

item.title: Adobe wants to create a robots.txt styled indicator for images used in AI training
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: For years, websites included information about what kind of crawlers were not allowed on their site with a robots.txt file. Adobe, which wants to create a similar standard for images, has added a tool to content credentials with an intention to give them a bit more control over what is used to train AI models. […]

item.title: Adobe releases new Firefly image generation models and a redesigned Firefly web app
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Adobe on Thursday launched the latest iteration of its Firefly family of image generation AI models, a model for generating vectors, and a redesigned web app that houses all its AI models, plus some from its competitors. There’s also a mobile app for Firefly in the works. The new Firefly Image Model 4, Adobe says, […]

item.title: Mystery will may reveal Zappos founder’s final wishes
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: According to the WSJ, a recently discovered will suggests late Zappos co-founder Tony Hsieh had concrete plans for his fortune despite previous beliefs that he died without leaving instructions for an estate that’s estimated to be worth $1.2 billion. Among other things, the document, signed in 2015 and included in a recent court filing, contains […]

item.title: IBM affected by DOGE cuts, downplays impact during Q1 earnings call
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Tech and consulting giant IBM was not immune to the Department of Government Efficiency’s (DOGE) cuts. IBM had 15 of its federal contracts canceled due to DOGE-related cuts during the first quarter of 2025, according to reporting from Reuters and Bloomberg. These cuts amount to $100 million in future payments, per Bloomberg. Federal contracts represent […]

item.title: Windsurf slashes prices as competition with Cursor heats up
item.dc:creator: Charles Rollet
item.description: AI coding assistant startup Windsurf cut its prices “across the board” it announced on Monday, touting “massive savings” for its users as competition with its rival Cursor intensifies. Windsurf said it’s getting rid of its complex system of “flow action credits,” which charged developers for actions its AI did in the background. It’s also cutting […]

item.title: Tesla begins ‘FSD Supervised’ ride-hail tests with employees in Austin, Bay Area
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Tesla has started testing its autonomous ride-hail service with employees in Austin and the Bay Area ahead of the company’s planned robotaxi launch this summer. “FSD Supervised ride-hailing service is live for an early set of employees in Austin & San Francisco Bay Area,” the company posted Wednesday on X. FSD stands for “Full Self-Driving,” […]

item.title: Government censorship comes to Bluesky, but not its third-party apps … yet
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Government censorship has found its way to Bluesky, but there’s currently a loophole thanks to how the social network is structured. Earlier this month, Bluesky restricted access to 72 accounts in Turkey at the request of Turkish governmental authorities, according to a recent report by the Freedom of Expression Association. As a result, people in Turkey can […]

item.title: OpenAI seeks to make its upcoming ‘open’ AI model best-in-class
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: Toward the end of March, OpenAI said it intended to release its first “open” language model since GPT‑2 sometime this year. Now, details about that model are beginning to trickle out from the company’s sessions with the AI developer community. Aidan Clark, OpenAI’s VP of research, is leading development of the open model, which is […]

item.title: Here are the 19 US AI startups that have raised $100M or more in 2025
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Last year was monumental for the AI industry in the U.S. and beyond. There were 49 startups that raised funding rounds worth $100 million or more in 2024, per our count at TechCrunch; three companies raised more than one “megaround,” and seven companies raised rounds $1 billion in size or larger. How will 2025 compare? […]

item.title: Netflix aims to be a trillion-dollar company, says co-CEO
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: At Semafor’s 2025 World Economy Summit on Wednesday, Netflix co-CEO Ted Sarandos said he believes Netflix’s long-term goal to achieve a $1 trillion market capitalization is possible if the streaming giant continues to perform well. Sarandos said, “In the previous five years, we’ve doubled our revenue, we grew profits 10 times, and we grew our […]

item.title: 19 US fintech startups have raised over $50M in 2025 so far
item.dc:creator: Mary Ann Azevedo
item.description: After a sluggish couple of years, fintech appears to be making a comeback. In the first quarter of 2025, fintech startups globally raised a combined $10.3 billion — marking the highest level of funding since the first quarter of 2023, according to CB Insights research. The average deal size of $17.7 million also marked the […]

item.title: Discord appoints former Activision Blizzard exec Humam Sakhnini as CEO
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Amid rumors that the company is eyeing an IPO, Discord appointed former Activision Blizzard Vice Chairman Humam Sakhnini as CEO. Discord co-founder Jason Citron will leave his CEO role after 13 years at the company. Discord straddles the gaming and social media spaces — despite its initial emergence as a platform for online multiplayer gamers […]

item.title: OpenAI’s GPT-4.1 may be less aligned than the company’s previous AI models
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: In mid-April, OpenAI launched a powerful new AI model, GPT-4.1, which it claimed “excelled” at following instructions. But the results of several independent tests suggest the model is less aligned — that is to say, less reliable — than previous OpenAI releases. When OpenAI launches a new model, it typically publishes a detailed technical report […]
